info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 30 at 10:46PM CDT by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN WARD, SOUTHWESTERN PIERCE AND MCHENRY COUNTIES THROUGH 1115 PM CDT... At 1045 PM CDT, strong thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles northwest of Denbigh to 6 miles east of Velva to 8 miles east of Benedict. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Denbigh and Karlsruhe around 1055 PM CDT. Towner around 1105 PM CDT. Drake around 1115 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Balfour, Logan, Bergen, Wolseth, Norwich, Voltaire, Berwick, George Lake, Kief and Simcoe. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. If on or near a lake, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass.
